args: Hey, have you heard the word on the\nstreet about all the unrest lately?
Guess that's a yes, then. So what,\nyou're just gonna pretend like\nnothing's happening?

Valkaheim's no longer a strong-eat-
the-weak kind of place, and all the former
top dogs are starting to bark super loud.
You're really okay with that?
But why are they agitated? Surely the\npolicies which protect the strong have\nnot changed.
All it means is that the weak can live in\npeace. Why would their ＂betters＂ be upset?
Great question, Mordecai.\nAs for the answer...
Ding ding. Valkaheim is now a haven\nfor the weak as well as the strong.\nAnd those at the top don't like that.
But why? That which they stand\nto gain remains unchanged.
They don't like knowing that anyone other\nthan themselves gets to feel good.

They want to tread upon the unfortunate
and stand cackling at the top of the heap.
That's the kind of place this used to be.
It attracted folks who believed that ethos.
Then all of a sudden, that changed.\nAnd folks not entirely convinced by the\nnew direction are raising their voices.
People can at times be incomprehensibly\nfoolish.
So, Leonidas, what's the glorious ruler of\nthose foolish people going to do about it?

I mean, I brought word to you precisely
because the situation's already gotten as
bad as it has. You can't keep burying your
head in the sand here.
Do not attempt to give me orders.
He left. What could he be thinking?
Who knows. But if he's not\ngoing to do anything right now...
Valkaheim'll be up in flames before long.
(What are you scheming, Leonidas?\nWhat could your true intentions be?)
This is Valkaheim—a place where the\nstrong eat the weak!
And if our lord has suddenly lost his\nteeth, then WE'LL dine in his stead!
The weak have no place here.\nStrength is everything!
The only people who deserve to be\nhappy here are the ones with the power!
Lots of people rallying around the idea of\n＂strength.＂ They certainly look the part.
Isn't it about time you told us\nwhat you're plotting, Leonidas?
They're gonna march on us before long.\nWe need a game plan, and fast.
This is Valkaheim. As they say,\npower is everything here.
Words will not avail us on fools. Thus,\nI will speak the only language they know...\nuntil I make them comprehend by force.
I have also called some of my brother's\ntroops. It will not take long to suppress\nthem.
I will crush them utterly, and teach you\nall the pleasure of a well-earned victory.
Your methods in reality are just as\ndisturbing as they are in chess.
...Well, he says we can hit them with\neverything we've got.\nLet's do this, Mordecai.
I will etch the reality of our hierarchy\ninto their very flesh and bone!
Let the ember become a blaze! Go, Mars!
Ahhh! It's gonna set us on fire!
What the hell kind of weapon's that\nlady shooting us with?!
The reinforcements from New Alberia\nare super tough, too...
Now answer me! What does it mean\nto be strong?
T-to have lots of troops at your disposal?
Wrong. That is no more than mere muscle!
True strength is the power to guide\nthe weak! To wield authority in the name\nof those who cannot fight for themselves!
No way... That's not the kind of place\nthis was ever supposed to be!
True. For I was once like you.\nI believed that with strength alone,\nI could achieve my dreams.
But I was mistaken. My brother, who has\nsomething I lack, helped me understand.
There is no inherent folly in being\nstrong. But power alone does not\nmake dreams reality.
Your neighbors are not your enemy.\nChannel all of your strength into\nenriching the lives of your fellows!
Use your strength, your intellect, and all\nyour capabilities to shepherd the weak!
Depending on your actions henceforth,\nI will give you what you want, whether it\nbe wealth or status alike.
This is the new rule of Valkaheim!
Under normal circumstances, I would have\nalready sentenced you rebels to death. But\nthis time only, I will overlook your actions.
Know that my mercy is a one-time gift.\nYour lives have been spared.\nDo with them as you will. That is all.
Use the strength that I cultivated to\nrise up for someone else?
I thought my strength wasn't good\nfor anything but fighting. Is he saying\nthere are even broader applications?
But we ourselves don't have\nto do anything different, yeah?
We're still usin' our fists, we're just usin'\nthem to protect the weak. Is that it?
The weak just moseyed through life all\ncarefree, and it really got under my skin.
But you're saying that from now on,\nit's exactly BECAUSE those people\nexist that we can rise up in the world?
I like that! Let's DO it!
Agreed. Prince Leonidas saved my\nlife, so it makes sense that I should use\nit in service to him!
Well, color me impressed.\nCan't believe that was your aim all along.
Gather up all the rebels in one fell swoop,\nspare their lives, and get them indebted to\nyou. Bing, bam, done.
And by requesting relief from the seventh\nscion's forces, you minimized the damage\ndone to the city.

I was a little worried how things were
gonna play out, but I couldn't come up
with a more efficient method if I tried.
And I'm an ALCHEMIST! I invent stuff!
That was one heck of a turnabout.\nActually, no—just like in chess, you saw\nit coming. Right from the very beginning.
Daring though it was, the outcome was\nperfect. Almost annoyingly so.
If only I could be like him.
Uh, please no. I can't even imagine what\na headache it would be having a partner\nwho's as tricky to read as that guy.
Still, it makes you wonder what kind of\nperson the seventh scion is if he brought\nsomeone as fearsome as Leonidas to heel.
